BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: My Life As Me: Barry Humphries casts off his Dame Edna Everage mantle to read from his hilarious autobiography in his own voice. He recalls his early days in Melbourne. .

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The big switch on.

BasicDescription.Title: Midnight News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: Shipping Forecast
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest Shipping Forecast.

BasicDescription.Title: As BBC World Service
BasicDescription.Synopsis: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes. BBC Radio 4 resumes at 5.35am.

BasicDescription.Title: Radio 4 Open Up
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Includes a News Summary, the latest Shipping and Inshore Waters forecasts, and Prayer For The Day with the Reverend Elfed ap Nefydd Roberts.

BasicDescription.Title: Farming Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Agricultural news and features with Miriam O'Reilly.

BasicDescription.Title: Today
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With John Humphrys and Sarah Montague. Includes Sports Desk at 6.25am, 7.25am and 8.25am; Weather at 6.55am and 7.55am; Thought For The Day at 7.45am. Yesterday In Parliament at 6.45am.

BasicDescription.Title: Desert Island Discs
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Sue Lawley's castaway this week is the actor John Malkovich. He chooses eight records to take to the mythical island.

BasicDescription.Title: Book Of The Week
BasicDescription.Synopsis: My Life As Me: Barry Humphries casts off his Dame Edna mantle to read from his hilarious autobiography. He describes how he met Salvador Dali and his wife. .

BasicDescription.Title: Woman's Hour
BasicDescription.Synopsis: With Martha Kearney. Includes, at 10.45am [rptd today 7.45pm] the drama, Live Alone And Like It, by Marjorie Hillis. Will Frank seize the day? After all, it's his last chance.

With Martha Kearney. Includes, at 10.45am [rptd today 7.45pm] the drama:
Live Alone And Like It
By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler.
It's the publishing party of the season, the launch of the Book of the Month. Everybody is there, including Frank. But will he seize the day? After all, it's his last chance.
When it was published in 1935, Live Alone And Like It rapidly became a best-seller both here and in America. With chapter headings like Solitary Refinement; Your Leisure - If Any; Pleasures Of A Single Bed; Will You Or Won't You? and A Lady And Her Liquor, it covered every aspect of the single life. So get out your best bedjacket, and lie back and enjoy Mary Cutler's hilarious and imaginative account.
Marjorie ...... Serena Evans Judith ...... Celia Imrie Sylvia ...... Haydn Gwynne Frank ...... Robert Daws Miss Stark ...... Alison Carney

BasicDescription.Title: Reports Of My Death
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Former Times obituarist Anthony Howard spells out the consequences for all concerned whenever someone utters Mark Twain's memorable riposte.

BasicDescription.Title: Millport
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The End Of The Beginning: The island make-over has turned horribly sour. And with Irene gone the only person to save the island from being bulldozed is Bunty Pierce.

The End Of The Beginning
The island make-over has turned horribly sour, and with Irene gone the only person to save the island from being bulldozed is Bunty Pierce. But with her ailing health and hermit ways will she leave her vegetables to rescue the island's integrity? And will Irene change her mind about mainland life and return to the island for good?
Cast includes:
Lynn Ferguson ...... Irene Bruce Janet Brown ...... Moira Bruce, Agnes Scobie Gabriel Quigley ...... Ena MacLean, Bunty Pierce Robert Paterson ...... Bob, The Minister Lewis MacLeod ...... Alberto Fabrollizzi Robert the Dog, Ferryman, Morris Mowen, Kenneth Bryans ...... Dougie MacGoogan

BasicDescription.Title: News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news headlines from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: You And Yours
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Consumer news and discussion with With Liz Barclay and Winifred Robinson.

BasicDescription.Title: The World At One
BasicDescription.Synopsis: National and international news from BBC Radio 4. With reports from our correspondents worldwide. Presented by Nick Clarke.

BasicDescription.Title: A World In Your Ear
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Emily Buchanan presents highlights from English-language radio programmes from around the world. In this edition, how new talent finds its way onto the airwaves or fails to.

BasicDescription.Title: Afternoon Play
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Agnes Beaumont By Herself: By Stephen Wyatt. A 22 year old Puritan and protege of John Bunyan, is accused of murder. A true story inspired by The Narrative Of Mrs Agnes Beaumont from 1674.

Agnes Beaumont By Herself
A 22 year old Puritan, and protege of John Bunyan, is accused of murder. A true story inspired by The Narrative Of Mrs Agnes Beaumont written by Herself, published in 1674.
Agnes, the youngest daughter of a hard working Bedfordshire farmer is wooed by Lawyer Farry. He is an important man and her father approves of the match but Agnes wants the freedom to love, marry and worship where and when she pleases. She hero-worships the charismatic preacher John Bunyan. Local tongues wag for Bunyan is a married man.
On the fatal day Agnes' father grudgingly lets her go to church. When her promised lift fails to arrive, Agnes sees Bunyan. He knows a young girl riding pillion will fuel local gossip, but he cannot refuse her. Agnes returns home to a terrible row with her father. The next night he is taken ill and dies. Farry accuses Agnes of poisoning him and names Bunyan as an accomplice. Agnes is arrested. If found guilty she will burn at stake.
Cast includes:
Katy Cavanagh ...... Agnes Beaumont Adrian Scarborough ...... John Bunyan Jon Strickland ...... Beaumont Paul Ritter ...... Lawyer Farry

BasicDescription.Title: Veg Talk
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Food writer and cook Elisabeth Luard joins Gregg and Charlie and raises the temperature with some fabulous flavours from Latin America. Call in on 0870 010 0444 [national rate].

BasicDescription.Title: Love And Loss
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Flight: By Amanda Smyth. A young girl grows up in the shadow of her mother's love life. By Hanan-al-Shaykh.

BasicDescription.Title: Blood Chronicles
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Blood Money: Graeme Garden examines how blood became "red gold" and how it has become a global industry. He examines some of the advantages and some of the problems this causes.

BasicDescription.Title: Word Of Mouth
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Winter Draws On: A look at the curious and sometimes confusing world of Homophones. Plus, premium parlance - the language they're using to part us from our cash this Christmas.

BasicDescription.Title: The Message
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Jenni Murray and guests engage in lively conversation about how current media trends affect our lives.

BasicDescription.Title: PM
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Full coverage and analysis of the day's news, plus the sports headlines. Presented by Eddie Mair and Carolyn Quinn.

BasicDescription.Title: Six O'Clock News
BasicDescription.Synopsis: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.

BasicDescription.Title: The News Quiz
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A tongue in cheek review of the week's news, brought to you by Simon Hoggart, Alan Coren, Andy Hamilton, Jeremy Hardy and special guests.

BasicDescription.Title: The Archers
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Brian finds a sympathetic ear.

BasicDescription.Title: Front Row
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Arts news, interviews and reviews with Francine Stock.

BasicDescription.Title: Live Alone And Like It
BasicDescription.Synopsis: By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler. It's the publishing party of the season. Everybody is there. Will Frank seize the day? It's his last chance.

By Marjorie Hillis, dramatised by Mary Cutler.
It's the publishing party of the season, the launch of the Book of the Month. Everybody is there, including Frank. But will he seize the day? After all, it's his last chance.
When it was published in 1935, Live Alone And Like It rapidly became a best-seller both here and in America. With chapter headings like Solitary Refinement; Your Leisure - If Any; Pleasures Of A Single Bed; Will You Or Won't You? and A Lady And Her Liquor, it covered every aspect of the single life. So get out your best bedjacket, and lie back and enjoy Mary Cutler's hilarious and imaginative account.
Marjorie ...... Serena Evans Judith ...... Celia Imrie Sylvia ...... Haydn Gwynne Frank ...... Robert Daws Miss Stark ...... Alison Carney

BasicDescription.Title: Any Questions?
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Jonathan Dimbleby chairs a topical discussion from Burford School in Oxfordshire. The panel includes Patricia Hewitt MP, Lord Jenkins and author Frederick Forsyth.

BasicDescription.Title: Letter From America
BasicDescription.Synopsis: By Alistair Cooke. Insight, anecdote and history from the doyen of commentators.

BasicDescription.Title: The Friday Play
BasicDescription.Synopsis: In The Bosom Of The Slag: By Richard Cameron. A Drag Queen and ex-miner attempts a world record to raise money for a Women's Action Group.

In The Bosom Of The Slag
By Richard Cameron
18 years on from the Miners' strike, and Charmaine (Drag Queen and ex-miner) is climbing into the Guinness Book of Records with 45 days non-stop organ playing. As an associate member of the Women's Action Group he's raising money to support what they are trying to do to get the community off its knees after the strike that split families and opened up wounds that still haven't healed.
Cast includes:
Charmaine ...... Paul Copley Rose ...... Helen Longworth Frankie ...... Melanie Hill Irene ...... Anne Carroll Bridget ...... Kathryn Pogson Kyla ...... Rebecca Callard Jodie ...... Emma Jengs Gina ...... Carla Simpson Geoff ...... Steve Hodson Pete ...... Steve Garti John ...... Shaun Dooley
Directed by Janet Whitaker

BasicDescription.Title: The World Tonight
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Zeinab Badawi presents analysis of the day's national and international stories, including interviews with politicians and public figures.

BasicDescription.Title: Book At Bedtime
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Tiger In The Smoke: By Margery Allingham. Tonight, as Jack Havoc lives up to his name, Meg and Amanda have a close encounter in the dark.

BasicDescription.Title: Great Lives
BasicDescription.Synopsis: Guardian cartoonist Steve Bell nominates the eighteenth century caricaturist James Gillray as his Great Life. With presenter Humphrey Carpenter, art historian Richard Godfrey and James Bolam.

BasicDescription.Title: Today In Parliament
BasicDescription.Synopsis: A review of the day's events in Parliament.
